lead_paragraph: Tank Johnson’s blood alcohol level was .072, below the presumptive legal limit of .08, when he the was arrested in Gilbert, Ariz., on suspicion of drunken driving June 22, the police said. No charges have been filed against Johnson, a former Bears defensive tackle, pending the results of an investigation. Johnson, 25, was released by the Bears three days after his arrest. The team said it was “upset and embarrassed” by his legal troubles.
